website_summaries.verdict: Built like a toy, but provides quick and accurate results.
pros: We love the impressive laser device that levels out lines with studded walls and other challenging surfaces
Use indoors, as reviews cite this measuring tool will provide easy and accurate results for most environments

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as a level
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as a level, fairly bright and narrow laser line. A big plus is that the self-leveling function can be turned off and the cross hairs left on. This is very handy for projecting perpendicular lines on a wall, floor, or ceiling. Perfect for tile work. You can even rotate the cross hairs, e.g. for a diagonal pattern. Other pluses are the threaded mounting hole for use on a camera tripod, and the articulated arm which permits projecting lines in any position or angle. Bottom line - if I lost this one, would I buy another? Yes. Well designed, easy to use, well priced.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great value but needs a stronger laser
customer_reviews.text: It works and you can use it from any angle which is great (by that I mean, the attachment can connect to any side of the box, so you can always find an angle that works). The problem is the laser light is not strong. With any light (be in sunlight or lamplight), I can barely see the laser unless it's within 3-4 feet of what I'm pointing it at. For the price in comparison to other products of the same nature, I would still recommend this as I'm sure you can make it work, but improving the visibility of the actual laser would make this a 5-star product.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great small project self level laser.
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great line laser level. I wanted something to help with hanging pictures and artwork in the house and this is perfect. Instead of using levels and tapes, I can get out my adjustable height ladder and set the laser at the height I need and just start hanging. Max range in normal light is about 20', it starts to get dim after that. I haven't used it outside yet, but it probably is not bright enough under most conditions. However, its a great indoor small project self leveling laser. The level also has a separate mode non-self leveling mode, where it will "paint" a straight line based on the orientation of the laser.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: great for the price for a single big project and ...
customer_reviews.text: great for the price for a single big project and looks fairly durable. Using to finish our basement and the self leveling and distance it throws a laser is great. My only complaint is that the unit needs to be fairly far back to cast a laser on the ceiling to run the distance needed. It seems about 3-4ft in front of the unit will not display the beam on the ceiling. It is not horrible but something to keep in mind for tight spots. Makes getting plum walls easy. The mount is nice too plan to use it for setting my outlet box's hight for given walls.
customer_reviews.author: GM77

customer_reviews.title: great item for the home handyman
customer_reviews.text: I had a shelving project that I just could not seem to get right (level). I bought this and had everything perfect in a matter of minutes. People that review say it is not bright enough, I had no problem with that but my project was inside. I used the item mounted on a tripod and it worked well. The clamp on mount that it comes with looks pretty flimsy and probably wouldn't have worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: gregg williams

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It's compact, not too expensive, does cross-line self leveling and manual, has a locking mechanism when the laser is off. Lines are bright and not too thick. The mounting bracket is a bit flimsy and hard to grip, but better than not having one. I would say it's good for weekend warriors.
customer_reviews.author: Laurent Bourg

customer_reviews.title: For INDOOR USE ONLY
customer_reviews.text: let there be a clear warning: this device Does NOT work Outdoors. This is designed for indoor use and works very well indoors. outside, on a very overcast day, at 3 feet - with the "special" red glasses, then I can see a bit of a line. outside​, inside of a carport, I managed to get a line at about 6 feet.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jolley

customer_reviews.title: Works Ok, but attachment arm failed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to level a ceiling I was putting in on my covered deck. There is an arm and a clamp that comes with the cubix. I had trouble attaching it to a rough cut 2X6. The adjustment knob on the arm is plastic and it stripped. This could have been done a bit better. The cubix itself works fine. With 20/20 hind sight...I'd probably purchase a better model.
customer_reviews.author: Snuzzy

customer_reviews.title: Great Laser.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this laser in a number of situations and it has really helped. I am currently laying new baseboard after repainting walls in my house. The Stanley Cubix Cross Line Laser has provided a quick way to line up and adjust for height. My next project is to rip out my tub and install a tiled shower. I do believe the laser is going to make things go smoother and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Used it during koi pond construction
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Used it during koi pond construction. Laser line is strong. Used it right before sun set and still see laser lit up target at 20ft. Also bought laser glass to help the the line but never need to wear bc the laser line is powerful enough to see it with the naked eyes. Would buy this line laser again.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbend

customer_reviews.title: The price is ok, but the lines it shots ...
customer_reviews.text: The price is ok, but the lines it shots aren't very long. You'll never get the vertical line to project onto the ceiling in a normal sized room.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltan

customer_reviews.title: I give it a thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: Works great indoors. Brighter than the last one I had. The clamp makes it more versatile, but is a little awkward to use. I find it hard to move "just a little", but once it's positioned just right, it's great. Good value for the price. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Well made and durable. I use it way more than I thought I would. Just love it. Great battery life. It is very easy to use. I used it to put up chair molding in my office and it turned out perfect because of this tool!
customer_reviews.author: akadrum

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: It is defective. Does obtain and keep a level line.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: great laser; took me some time to getting used ...
customer_reviews.text: great laser; took me some time to getting used to it. But i use it a lot (specifically for hanging closet shelves).
customer_reviews.author: George_MD

customer_reviews.title: tempermental, and not bright.
customer_reviews.text: D student. Most of the time, the laser didnt want to come on, and when it did, it wasnt very bright. Even with red glasses, it was useless past 10 feet unless you did your outdoor sighting at well after dusk, or in the dark. :(
customer_reviews.author: GeoffyGeoff

customer_reviews.title: Cubix Cross Line Laser
customer_reviews.text: I got this to aid in hanging many pictures in our renovated house. Very handy both for leveling pictures as well as marking the target for where to put the hangers. It does reduce the need for some repetitive measurements, at least the way I work.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasT

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far.
customer_reviews.text: The clamp included is somewhat good but be careful with the screws . they can damage the plastic thread.
customer_reviews.author: alex cuadrado

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if the horizontal and Verticle could be turned on ...
customer_reviews.text: The clamp does not work very well and does not alway come loose. Would be great if the horizontal and Verticle could be turned on independantly.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Torres

customer_reviews.title: Weak arm
customer_reviews.text: It works ok. I don't like weak mounting arm it has. It does not grip well. Will look for another light.
customer_reviews.author: Yepuna

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: It's the best price that I could find for a laser level that provided these features. I tried it out after I got it, and it does what it says it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette D Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Floating mechanism sticks easily.
customer_reviews.text: Will only work on level surfaces (or tripods). Floating mechanism sticks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Travis F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was brighter, but that's me being picky
customer_reviews.author: Marco Fallas

customer_reviews.title: Places a bright beam that's easy to see
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this level for product photography. Places a bright beam that's easy to see. I've been using for about 3 weeks and the batteries are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: hotel victor

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good cheap alternative for short distances <30 feet. Good for hanging door frames/closets in same room
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Langel

customer_reviews.title: Could be brighter but all in all descent for the money (I have 6 now)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as we have went through a bunch of the GL series bosches, its not super bright but I haven't had one of my guys break it yet. For indoor use only.
customer_reviews.author: Nick F

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of box. The switch is a little chincy, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Nick V

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive product that is well made for the non professional user
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for what it is designed to do. It is low in features, but also low in price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: First laser level I've bought. Easy to use and well worth the money. Real time saver verses using the old 4' level. And so much more accurate, especially with dealing the crown in your lumber. Takes a bit to change your ways, but will always use a laser level from know on.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Reeb

customer_reviews.title: Decent tool.
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift. Seems to work well..Included clamp a bit cheesy but works.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.S.

customer_reviews.title: My husband hasn't needed this as much as he thought ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband hasn't needed this as much as he thought he would, but he says it works well when he has used it.
customer_reviews.author: J & C

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but the laser is not as bright as other s I have had
customer_reviews.text: Laser is not very bright. It works well and I like the clamp that is comes with though
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: A must have... Very good.
customer_reviews.text: A must have to install tiled, doors and cabinets. Keep your hands free and provides a good reference of level all time during your work. Helps a lot. Only for indoor use because the laser is not that strong but very good for the Price.
customer_reviews.author: Clovis De Almeida Junior

customer_reviews.title: Works good for how cheap it is
customer_reviews.text: Works good for how cheap it is. Used to install subway tile in bathroom and kept all my lines straight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best later but worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It's not the best laser but you get what you pay for. It will work for homeowner use indoors
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Adachi

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to find a gift for someone in the building business, but this is one they can get a lot of use out of.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I have a tripod for a camera I ...
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a bunch of neat accessories. Works great. I have a tripod for a camera I use with this.
customer_reviews.author: asev

customer_reviews.title: An on-the-level review
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Could be a bit brighter for use in sunny spaces, but very accurate and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Block's Writer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Leveling works just fine, but it's not bright enough to use outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little lazer. It functions perfectly for the home projects and light construction I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: George S.

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 usages!
customer_reviews.text: It probably is a good item, but mine is not working after using it only twice. The laser beams won't display as if the central led is fused. Very disappointed by Stanley for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Grégory

customer_reviews.title: Back to the drawing board
customer_reviews.text: Laser is great but it should have two built in levels also the mounting clamps are not well constructed or designed.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Umberger

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would be a great little unit if the laser was a bit brighter.
customer_reviews.author: A. Doerr

customer_reviews.title: good for small, close up projects
customer_reviews.text: The laser works works good and self levels well. The only issue is that the laser beam is somewhat dim if you are not close to the wall being leveled.
customer_reviews.author: George Gibson

customer_reviews.title: I just set this up and it works fine for inside use for cutting and alignments on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I just set this up and it works fine for inside use for cutting and alignments on my Velocity XLRG aircraft. There is a manual switch side for tilting at angels and a auto switch side if you not plum. The switch or laser had a few glitches at first on the auto side but seems to work good now.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Traynor

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful! Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Extremely useful! Simple to use, effective, mounts easily to a camera tripod. Self leveling feature is extremely useful. The laser lines projected across walls make marking straight lines easy and the lines. I don't know how we managed without this level before!
customer_reviews.author: GoodFoodLover

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy. Not really using it for its intended ...
customer_reviews.text: Cool toy. Not really using it for its intended purpose, but it works great for aligning the crosshairs on a rifle scope.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Laser Level!
customer_reviews.text: Great product but it can be difficult to find a place to clamp the level. Best method would be a tripod but that also can be difficult to use in a small area such as a bathroom or a closet.
customer_reviews.author: JMags

customer_reviews.title: it has already been fun to play with
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to using it, it has already been fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Roush

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I had the Bosch laser for about a year of light homeowner usage, and one day the switch simply broke off. That is when I discovered that the only part Bosch will sell you is the battery cover. I resolved to just replace it with something less costly, and bought this Stanley. It does exactly what the Bosch does for less. We'll see how it holds up, but I am happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Staying level
customer_reviews.text: I haven't use it for any projects yet but I have played with it testing my pictures on the walls. :)
customer_reviews.author: izzybellann

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works just as it should. Buy if you need an inexpensive laser level, It has a locked and self leveling mode.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: so far still working well and I have used it ...
customer_reviews.text: so far still working well and I have used it many times in my work (I m a tiler setter) since i bought it 6 months ago
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not enough instructions in box and complicated to work out
customer_reviews.author: Darlene geisler

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. the lines are not level, not even close.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Doe

customer_reviews.title: found it annoying to
customer_reviews.text: was not what I expected. found it annoying to use
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: STANLEY STHT77340 Cubix Cross Line Laser
product_meta.description: The STANLEY STHT77340 - Cubix Cross Line Laser features self leveling cross lines which projects bright horizontal & vertical lines onto flat surfaces for common leveling and alignment applications. This unit also features a QuickLink bracket and mounting system which is designed as a versatile bracket that links into multiple product mounting slots and 1/4" thread clamps on to multiple surfaces. Range 40'/Accuracy +/-5/16". This accurate performance supports common DIY and tradesman applications. It has a locking pendulum and helps to prevent damage to internal components. It boasts of a compact, lightweight design. Uses (2) AA batteries, included.
feature_bullets: Self Leveling Cross Lines: Projects bright horizontal & vertical lines onto flat surfaces
Locking pendulum helps prevent damage to internal components
This is a Class 1 laser product, Power output ≤ 1mW

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars113 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
